She resides in and rents a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

Fatuma changed her business enterprise from a retail shop to fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for a few months. She buys fruits and vegetables from the same villages where she works and so doesn’t incur any transport costs to and from shopping. She sells both retail and wholesale to all categories of people. Her business challenges are thieves and the fact that most fruits are seasonal.

Fatuma wants to use this loan to buy more baskets of fruits like mangoes, pineapples and cabbages. She is hoping to see her business grow big and to start buying directly from farmers.

Fatuma decided to work with MCDT SACCO because of its good customer care.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of mangoes, pineaples and cabbages

loans.name: Carla Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Carla Roxana vive en la zona sur Urb. El Palmar , tiene una venta de abarrotes la cual atiende en el dia y por las noches estudia en la universidad, tambien tiene un punto internet en la cual es ayudada por su hermana y cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.El prestamo es para aumentar su venta, surtirla con mas productos, como ser fideo, arroz, aceite, refrescos, dulces, etc.Ella es una persona trabajadora, se esfuerza por salir adelante con la venta de abarrotes y sus estudios su deseo es de llegar a ser profecional y asi poder mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carla Roxana lives in the southern part of the El Palmar neighborhood. She has a grocery business which she attends to during the day and she studies at the university in the evenings. She also has an internet cafe, her sister and parents help her with this. The loan is to make her able to increase her sales by increasing her assortment of products, such as noodles, rice, oil, refreshments, sweets, etc.. She is a hard working person, she puts much effort in getting ahead with the sales of groceries and her studies. Her desire is to become a professional and this way be able to improve the quality of life of her whole family. She is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for their trust in awarding this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, noodles, oil.

loans.name: Ndum

texts.en:
G. Ndum is a married mother of five who currently lives in Chuaku, Belo-Cameroon. G. is currently requesting her third loan from GHAPE. She has been with GHAPE since 2007, and she has demonstrated a creditworthy character exemplified by her repayments, consistent attendance at meetings, and support of her borrowing group.  

With this latest loan G. is hoping to continue the business practices supported by her prior loans. She has requested 165,000 XAF in order to purchase 10 bags of Irish potatoes for 120,000 XAF and palm oil for 45,000 XAF. She believes her business will succeed because of her prior success, ample client base, and increasing demand for her products. She hopes to use the profits from her business to pay her children's school fees, to purchase seeds for her farm, and to reinvest in her business. She will use this loan to manage current afflictions in her life such as the theft of a significant amount of money from her money and treatment for her mother who only has use of one eye.

G.'s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit nongovernmental organization based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and the alleviation of poverty through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase Irish potatoes and palm oil

loans.name: Jose Marvin

texts.es: José Marvin tiene 49 años, se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de mecánico. Hace más de 15 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su familia, su hija menor de 3 años está a su cargo el y su esposa le brindan la educación y las comodidades necesarias. El inicio por medio de un amigo en un taller con el paso del tiempo a José le fue gustando este medio de vida con todos los ahorros que tenia de trabajar decide establecer su propio taller y el mismo ser el dueño. El está contento con este financiamiento por lo que es la primera oportunidad para salir adelante. Sueña con mejorar las instalaciones del taller.
texts.en:
Jose Marvin is 49 years old and works as a mechanic. He has been in this business for more than 15 years, always with the goal of earning money for his family. His eldest daughter, a 3 year old, is dependent on him and his wife, so they're responsible for her education and other needs. He started working in a shop through a friend's recommendation. Over time, Jose came to enjoy the work and with his savings decided to set up his own shop and be his own boss. He is glad of this financing since it is the best opportunity to get ahead. He plans to improve the facilities at the shop.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Damos Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Damas  Trabajadoras” se conforma  gracias al deseo de sus integrantes  de mejorar su calidad de vida, la mayoría de sus integrantes  ya  realiza actividades productivas. 
Entre las actividades realizadas se  encuentran  las ventas de frutas y verduras, venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne, empanadas de pollo, empanadas de jamón y queso.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Sotera quien se dedica a la venta de ropas desde un salón que posee en su casa.
Ella está muy contenta con su trabajo ya que ayuda a su marido con los gasto de la casa, su marido es jornalero de un fabrica.
A ella la ayudan sus hijos quienes se sienten muy orgullosos de su madre ya que ella procura mucho para que salgan adelante de la mejor manera posible. 
Desea renovar sus mercaderías para atraer más clientes en su negocio y para ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de  ropas como camperas, suéter, pantalones, buzos, camisas, blusas, vestidos, jeans, y otros.
texts.en:
The group “Damas Trabajadoras” was formed because of the desire of the members to improve their quality of life. The majority of the members already have productive businesses. The types of activities they are engaged in include the sale of fruits and vegetables and the sale of handmade food items such as empanadas filled with meat, chicken, ham and cheese. One of the members is Señora Sotera, who sells clothing from a shop that she has in her home. She is very satisfied with her work, which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. Her husband works in a factory. Her children help her with the business; they are very proud of their mother since she tries very hard to provide for them in the best way possible. She wants to refresh her inventory of merchandise to attract more customers to her business, and to do this she seeks a loan to buy clothing such as jackets, sweaters, pants, sweatshirts, shirts, blouses, dresses, jeans and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy jackets, T-shirts, socks, sweatshirts, shirts, sweaters, and other garments

loans.name: Eveling

texts.es: La Sra. Eveling A. D. E.  vive en la el Barrio 30 D. marzo en la calle Taropé, D. la zona del 5to anillo y radial 10, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida que entrega a los pensionados que tiene D. una empresa que se encuentra al frente D. su casa, todos lo días se levanta muy temprano para comenzar con las labores en cocina ya que tiene que entregar 25 almuerzos completos y algunos más que le piden extra, la Sra. Eveling necesita el crédito para comprar un horno y una cocina nueva que son las herramientas D. trabajo diario que ella necesita, en la foto se pueD. observar la cocina donD. a diario prepara sus platos. La Sra. Eveling ha trabajado con créditos en emprender desD. el año 2008, desD. entonces se ha caracterizado por ser una cliente ejemplar, carismática, responsable y trabajadora. Ella desea que todos sus hijos terminen la universidad para así sentirse satisfecha con todo el esfuerzo que realiza diariamente al preparando comida para generar sustentos para las mejores condiciones D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eveling A. D. E. lives in the 30 D. Marzo neighbourhood, on Tarope street. She works at the preparation of food, which she delivers to some retirees who have a store in the front of their house. Every day, she gets up very early to begin her work in the kitchen, since she has to deliver 25 finished meals, as well as extras on request. Eveling needs this loan to buy a new oven and stove, which are tools that she needs for her daily work. In the photo, she can be seen with the stove on which she prepares her dishes daily. Eveling has worked with loans from Emprender since 2008. Since that time she has proven herself to be a model client; charismatic, responsible and hard working. She would like to see all her children complete university. That would make all her daily work preparing food to create a better quality of life for her family worthwhile.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a stove and oven

loans.name: Ngombol2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NGOMBOL 2 est créé le 28 décembre 2009. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de THIEO. Il est composé de 15 femmes issues du même village.

Madame Saly T., assise sur la photo en deuxième position à partir de la droite et levant la main, est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle a également la charge d’un des enfants de sa sœur .

Elle est vendeuse de fruits de saison. Elle vend essentiellement des mangues.

Avec son prêt elle va acheter 20 paniers de mangues. Elle recycle son achat au moins deux par semaine. 
Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The NGOMBOL2 solidarity group was formed on December 28, 2009. It is a member of the THIEO Banc Villageois. There are 15 women from the same village in the group. Saly T., shown in the picture sitting second from the right and with her hand raised, is the leader of the solidarity group. She is a 58 year old, married woman with three children. She is also responsible for the care of one of her sister's children. She sells seasonal fruit, mainly mangoes. She will buy 20 baskets of mangoes with her loan. She buys mangoes at least two times per week. Her goal is to financially participate in supporting the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 baskets of mangoes

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras de Cerrito de la Ciudad de Benjamín  Aceval Chaco. Actualmente se encuentran en el séptimo ciclo y todas la socias se encuentran satisfechas con los trabajos que cada una realiza.
El chaco es una región Paraguaya muy desfavorecida por el ecosistema caracterizado por ser muy seco, por ello es muy sacrificado realizar cualquier actividad, además hay poca población por lo que para vender cualquier producto se debe viajar hasta otras ciudades en buses.
 La señora Elizabeth es una de las integrantes y se dedica a varias actividades, cría de animales como cerdos y gallinas para consumo familiar, pero su actividad principal es la venta de juegos de azar en la zona céntrica.
Ella todos los días sale para vender sus juegos y de esa forma obtiene ingreso diario, pero está muy interesada en alquilar un salón en el mercado de Asunción.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para algunos gastos que posee en su casa, alimentación y vestimenta especialmente.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras de Cerrito” (Enterprising Women of Cerrito) group is from the city of Benhamín Aceval, Chaco. They are currently in their seventh cycle. All of the members are pleased with the work that they do. El Chaco is a Paraguayan region that is disadvantaged because it is very dry. Hence, it takes a lot a sacrifice for any business. Also, there is a small population. In order to sell any product you need to travel to other cities on buses. Elizabeth is one of the members. She dedicates herself to various activities. She raises animals like pigs and chickens for the family’s consumption. Her primary activity is selling games of chance in the central area. She leaves everyday to sell her games. That is how she gets daily income. She is very interested in renting a place in the Asunción market. She is currently requesting a loan for some house expenses, for food, and especially for clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food and clothing expenses

loans.name: Saf Niep Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAF NIEP est créé le 28 décembre 2009. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de THIEO. Il est composé de 14 femmes issues du même village.

Madame Thioro D., assise au milieux et levant la main sur la photo, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants

Elle fait de la restauration. Elle vend le petit déjeuner dans son quartier. Elle maîtrise bien son activité pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois il ya deux ans.

Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter 2 sacs de niébé, 20 paquets de pate alimentaire et 15 litres d’huile.

Avec ses bénéfices elle compte payer le ravitaillement pour la nourriture de sa famille et payer des frais médicaux pour d’éventuels cas de maladie.
texts.en:
The SAF NIEP solidarity group was formed on December 28, 2009. It is a member of the THIEO Banc Villageois. There are 14 women from the same village in the group. Khady T., shown in the picture sitting in the middle and with her hand raised, is the leader of the group. She is a 55 years old married woman with four children. She has a restaurant business. She sells breakfast in her neighborhood. She has been successful in this business since becoming affiliated with the Banc Villageois two years ago. This loan will allow her to buy two bags of black-eyed peas, 20 packets of pasta and 15 liters of oil. With the revenues, she plans to pay for her family's food supplies and for any future medical expenses.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two bags of black-eyed peas, 20 packets of pasta and 15 liters of oil

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is widowed with ten children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her brother’s children. She resides in and owns four-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes food and school fees.

Florence owns a bar in Kyebando Nsooba selling all types of drinks like beer, soda and local gin and has been in this business for over twenty years. She works from her home and sells both retail and wholesale to all categories of people, working seven days a week.

Florence buys her crates of beer, soda and local gin from delivery vans and so doesn’t incur any transport costs because she buys from her home. Her business challenges are the rainy season and defaulters.

Florence is aspiring to see her business grow big and to start selling wholesale only. She decided to work with MCDT SACCO because of the low interest rate charged.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, soda and local gin to sell

loans.name: Berno

texts.es: El Sr. Berno vive en el Barrio el Mirador de la urb. El Recreo, de la zona del plan  3000, el se dedica a l transporte publico  y a la venta de verduras tiene su puesto en el mercado los pozos cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas. El crédito es para construir un cuarto y su baño y necesita material de construcción como cemento, loza, etc.  El se levanta a las tres de la mañana para ir al mercado abasto y comprar las verduras que lleva al mercado los pozos, luego trabaja con su vehículo hasta las cinco de la tarde. El Sr. Berno es una persona trabajadora y dedicada a su familia siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Berno lives in the Mirador neighborhood in the El Recreo housing development of the Plan 3000 zone. He works in public transportation and selling vegetables. He has a stand in the Los Pozos market, and his daughters help him. The loan is to build a bathroom. He needs construction materials like cement and flagstone, etc. He gets up at three in the morning to go to the suppliers’ market. He buys vegetables there, and he takes them to the Los Pozos market. Then he works with his vehicle until five in the afternoon. Berno is a hard-working person who is devoted to his family. He is always thinking of his family’s well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom

loans.name: Pedro German

texts.es:
Pedro de 43 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), el tiene una papelería desde hace años para poder mantener a su familia.   

Pedro comenzó vendiendo papelería desque que se caso porque en otra partes no tenia oportunidades de trabajar, ahora el tiene dos niñas que después de la escuela le ayudan a atender la papelería, ahora trabaja todos los días en la papelería y por las noches esta trabajando en una empresa para tener mas ingresos, su esposa atiende la papelería en las noches. 
  
Para tener mas surtida su papelería el quiere comprar con el préstamo vitrinas y papelería. En el futuro quiere que su negocio prospere y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Pedro German, 43 years old, lives in Primavera de Duran (in an area outside Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecosystem). He has had a paper shop for many years in order to support his family. Pedro started selling paper goods when he got married since he had no other job prospects. He now has two daughters who help him in the store after school. He works every day at the store and evenings at a company to increase his income. His wife works at the store during the evenings. He wants to use the loan to buy window displays and paper goods to diversify his inventory. In the future, he wants his business to prosper and to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Window displays, paper goods

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis Carlos Cárdenas tiene 48 años y es un hombre muy responsable de sus obligaciones crediticias, tal como lo demuestra su historia; él  se dedica a la venta de alimentos fritos, pero últimamente quiere adicionarle pequeños deditos de queso, empanaditas de varios rellenos como carne, pollo, embutidos, arequipe y guayaba lo que diversificaría su oferta de productos. Su negocio inició hace más de siete años,  cuando quedó desempleado en el año 2007  y le ha servido de medio de sustento, por eso la realiza cuando hay mayor potencial de compras    de  viernes a domingos incluyendo los días feriados. El credikiva es el primer crédito que recibe a través de la   Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará  materias primas por volúmenes especialmente el aceite y  el maíz y las carnes y pollos  para la preparación  de sus deliciosas  y frescos productos alimenticios.

Sueña con ampliar su negocio y ubicarlo en un local propio teniendo varias empleadas, pero este es su principal desafío y en especial la falta de capital de trabajo para hacer los ajustes necesarios con el fin de que se den las condiciones,  así que espera trabajar duro para que su sueño se convierta en realidad.
texts.en:
Luis Carlos Cárdenas is 48 years old and is very responsible with his credit obligations as his history demonstrates. He sells fried foods for a living, but now he wants to add fried cheese sticks, small empanadas (turnovers) filled with various ingredients like meat, chicken, sausage, caramel and guava. This would diversify what he offers. He started his business more than seven years ago. When he lost his job in 2007 this became his main source of income. For this reason he works Fridays through Sundays, including fair days, because these are the days with the greatest potential for sales. This is his first loan with Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy raw materials in large quantities, especially oil, corn, meat and chicken for the preparation of his fresh and delicious dishes . He dreams of expanding his business and having his own place with several employees. His main challenge however, is the lack of working capital to make the necessary adjustments to make this happen. He hopes to work hard so that he can make his dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials in large quantities, especially oil, corn, meat and chicken for the preparation of his fresh and delicious dishes .

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. Alejandra vive en el barrio Urkupiña, de la zona del plan  3000, ella se dedica a la fabricación  y venta de edredones  que entrega al por mayor y al crédito, también vende otros productos al crédito como ser bañadores, lavadores y cestos de ropa, la Sra. Alejandra necesita el crédito para comprar una maquina industrial de costura para poder hacer la entrega de sus pedidos en un menor tiempo, la señora tiene la ayuda de su hija y en caso de que el trabajo sea mayor es colaborada por una de sus familiares. Ella es una persona trabajadora, responsable que se esfuerza para salir adelante con sus hijas, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandra lives in the Urkupiña neighborhood of the Plan 3000 suburb. She manufactures and sells bedspreads in bulk and on credit. Alejandra also sells other products on credit such as swimsuits, wash basins, and clothes hampers.

She needs a loan so that she can buy an industrial sewing machine to help her complete her orders in less time. Alejandra works with her daughter and whenever they receive large orders, they seek assistance from their relatives. She is a hardworking and responsible person who strives to get ahead alongside her daughters. Alejandra is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for providing this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial sewing machine & fabric

loans.name: Manassé Plus Group

texts.en:
Bibi B. is the leader of this community bank named “Manassé Plus” which is composed of thirteen micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Bibi sells salted fish in the eastern area of Kinshasa and has been in business since 1990. Her beginning capital was $30. Currently, through her sales, she makes about $70 per week. Bibi likes selling because it gives her the opportunity to make contacts with many different people, and once they become permanent clients she is able to offer them quality products at a better price.

Bibi plans to use this next loan to purchase seven bags of salted fish to resell in order to increase her income. She is a trustworthy client of HOPE DRC, having six times received and properly repaid loans.

Bibi is 53 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children whose ages are 9 and 14. Both attend school. She dreams one day of building a large business building for rent.

loans.use: To purchase seven bags of salted fish to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 33 años de edad, Reside en el municipio de Santa Elena, Departamento de Usulután, es casada tiene una hija de dos años de edad, vende productos de primera necesidad (Tienda).
El negoció está ubicado en la casa de habitación, atiende l negocio en un horario de 6:00am- 8:00pm tiene dos años de experiencia con el negocio, ella necesita un préstamo para compra de productos como son: Aceite, frijoles, azúcar, Jabón para baño, papel higiénico, jabón para lavar, gaseosa y embutidos. Esto contribuirá a mejora el negocio, atraer clientes, generar ingresos para cubrir necesidades básicas.
Los sueños de Rosa son tener un negocio grande, atraer clientes, continuar con el espíritu emprendedor para mejora las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old. She lives in the municipality of Santa Elena, in the Department of Usulután. She is married and has a two-year-old daughter. Her work is selling basic necessities (general store). Her business is located in the home where she lives. She operates her store from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm. She has two years of experience with the business. She needs a loan to buy products such as cooking oil, beans, sugar, bath soap, toilet paper, washing soap, soft drinks, lunch meats and sausages. This will help her improve her business, attract customers and generate income to cover her basic needs. Rosa's dreams are to have a large business, attact customers, and continue in an entrepreneurial spirit to improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cooking oil, beans, sugar, bath soap, toilet paper, washing soap, soft drinks, lunch meats and sausages

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO est créé le 28 décembre 2009. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de THIEO. Il est composé de 14 femmes issues du même village.

Madame Jeanne D., à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de couscous et de lait caillé. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 05 ans.

Avec son prêt elle va acheter 5 sacs de mil, pour la préparation du  couscous e, et 05 seaux de lait frais. 

Avec ses bénéfices elle compte acheter du ravitaillement pour la nourriture de la famille. Elle épargne aussi pour préparer le payement des frais de scolarité de ses enfants pour la rentrée scolaire prochaine.
texts.en:
The DEGGO solidarity group was formed on December 28, 2009. It is a member of the THIEO Banc Villageois. There are 14 women from the same village in the group. Jeanne D., at the far right of the photo, is the group leader. She is a 53 year-old, married woman with five children. She has been selling couscous and "lait caillé" (a lemony, thin yogurt sauce) in her small business for more than five years. With her loan, she plans to buy five bags of millet to make couscous and five pails of fresh milk. With the revenues, she plans to pay for her family's food supplies She is also putting money aside to pay for the tuition fees for her children for the upcoming school year.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy five bags of millet to make couscous and five pails of fresh milk.

loans.name: Mujeres De Serro Alto Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO MUJERES  DE CERRO ALTO

Este grupo esta conformado por doña Olga Marina C. Suicajau  casada de 22 años  además tiene 3 hijos su esposo la apoya en todo lo que pueda,  se dedica a la venta de pollo destazado en aldea Cerro Alto tiene ya 5 años de hacerlo.  Doña Dora Leticia Meléndez Márquez  tiene 43 años, 2 hijos es madre soltera y se dedica a una  tienda que tiene  ya 15 años de tenerla.  Doña Evelyn Hortensia R. M. tiene 34 años 2 hijos, su esposo esta en los Estados Unidos y  tiene el negocio de perfumes, venta de cosméticos,  zapatos por catalogo y ahora ya tiene  su local en su casa en donde vende todos los días, tiene ya 15 años de tener su negocio y  esta muy contenta porque ha visto que su negocio ha prosperado  ellas nos cuentan que quieren agrandar su negocio porque ahora  en la aldea ya hay mas personas que están solicitando sus productos y por eso solicitan este crédito y confían en que fape les pueda brindar su apoyo
texts.en:
Women of Cerro Alto Solidarity Group

This group consists of three women:

Doña Olga Marina C. Suicajau is 22 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband supports her in every way possible. She sells butchered chickens in the Cerro Alto neighborhood and has been doing this for five years.

Doña Dora Leticia Meléndez Márquez is 43 years old and a single mother of two children. She manages a store that she has owned for 15 years.

Doña Evelyn Hortensia R. M. is 34 years old and has two children. Her husband in the United States. She has a business selling perfumes, cosmetics, and shoes through catalogs. Now she has a store where she sells her products every day. Evelyn says she is very happy because she has seen her business prosper.

The ladies say they want to expand their businesses because now there are more people in their neighborhood who are requesting their products. For this reason, they are requesting this loan and are confident that FAPE will provide them support.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to be invested into the business

loans.name: Johanna Alexandra

texts.es: Johanna H. es una joven mujer que vive en el barrio la Reconquista de Bogotá, lugar de ubicación de  su taller de confecciones, donde  ella trabaja mediante el sistema de maquila, es decir recibe prendas cortadas previamente que ella ensambla, desde su casa donde tiene ubicada su maquinaria;   últimamente le han salido unos contratos directos para confeccionar la línea deportiva y de dotación  y por eso recurre a su credikiva pues quiere comprar la maquina collarína que le permite reducir los tiempos por operación de prendas. Este es justamente su primer crédito a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que conoció a través de su asesor de crédito y de personas que también tienen crédito y les ha ido muy bien; por ahora sigue pagando a destajo pero sueña con invertirle a su negocio, para que crezca y le genere la estabilidad económica con la que sueña y también que esta pueda generar empleos a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Johanna is a young woman who lives in the Reconquista de Bogota district where her garment workshop is located. She works under a "maquilla" (an assembly company) system. She receives pre-cut clothing to assemble from home where she has her machine. She has received some direct contracts to sew the sports and uniform lines lately. This is what prompted her request a loan from Kiva. She wants to purchase a collar sewing machine which will reduce the time it takes her to sew the clothing. This is her first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, organization she became familiar with through her loan advisor and people who have also requested loan and have been happy with it. For now she will continue to do piece work but she dreams of investing in her business for it to grow and generate the economic stability she longs for. She also wants to create jobs for the community.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a collar sewing machine

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is divorced with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister’s children. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, food and medication.

Dalia bakes donuts and crisps (chips), and also fries groundnuts (peanuts). She has been in this business for five years. She works from her home and so doesn’t pay rent for her business. She sells both retail and wholesale, working three days a week.

Dalia buys baking powder and groundnuts from Owino market, one of the busiest marts in Uganda. She wants to use this loan to buy more cartons of baking powder, cooking oil, a bag of Irish potatoes for making crisps and a sack of groundnuts.

Dalia is aspiring to pay school fees for her children up to university level and to own a fully-stocked bakery. She decided to work with MCDT SACCO because of its good customer care.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, groundnuts, cartons of  baking flour and cookinfg oil

loans.name: Darou Salam Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DAROUSALAM TACKU LIGGEY  est créé depuis le 29 janvier 2009. Il est composé de 15 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par des liens d’amitié, d’affinité et de voisinage. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de SINOU KHALY

Madame Ndèye Coumba G. debout  à l’extrême gauche de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de thé et de sucre. Elle vend en même temps du pain. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. 

Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter 100 paquets de thé et 2 grosses de sucre. 

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge familiale pour l’achat de provision pour la nourriture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group DAROUSALAM TACKU LIGGEY was created on January 29, 2009. It is made up of 15 women who all come from the same village. They came together as a group because of ties of friendship, similar interests, and neighborhood. This solidarity group is part of the "Banc Villageois" of SINOU KHALY Mrs. Ndèye Coumba G., standing on the far left in the photo, is the head of the group. She is 52, married, and raising three children. She has a little business selling tea and sugar. She also sells bread. She's been in this business for five years. Her loan will allow her to buy 100 packages of tea and two big packages of sugar. Her goal is to help support her family by buying food for them.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying tea and sugar

loans.name: Meylin Eliette

texts.es: Meylin tiene 41 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de huevos. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que la gran variedad de clientes que siempre están llegando a su vivienda a comprar a precio favorable y accesible, ella tiene mucho tiempo que es cliente de Fundación y ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Después de la separación con su esposo ha decidido continuar con este medio de vida. Pues es así que ha logrado aprender a ser una empresaria independiente. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima necesaria en mayor cantidad. Sueña con que su hijo logre curarse.
texts.en:
Meylin is 41 years old, and her business is buying and selling eggs. She has operated this business for more than 10 years, and she has built up a wide range of customers who regularly come to her home to buy her products at a favorable and accessible price. She has been a client of the Foundation for a long time, and she has made her payments in a correct and timely manner. After she and her husband separated, she decided to continue with this way of life. That is how she learned to become an independent entrepreneur. She is requesting this loan to buy needed supplies in larger quantities. Her dream is that her son will recover from a condition he has.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tacku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TACKU LIGGEY est créé le 29 janvier  2009. Il est composé de 13 femmes issues du même village. Elles se sont regroupées par voisinage et par amitié. Elles partagent pratiquement le même centre d’intérêt qui est le petit commerce. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de SINOU KHALY

Madame Fatim G., debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants et a en charge 1 autre enfants confié à son mari.

Elle est vendeuse de couscous. Elle pratique cette activité qui lui permet de gagner sa vie depuis bientôt une décennie

Son prêt lui servira à acheter du mil pour la préparation du couscous qu’elle transforme en couscous pour revendre dans son village.

Les bénéfices générés par son activité l’aideront à payer la nourriture pour sa famille et payer également des frais de santé en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
The solidarity group TACKU LIGGEY was created on January 29, 2009. It is made up of 13 women who all come from the same village. They came together because of friendship and as neighbors. They have more or less the same interest, petty trading. The solidarity group is a part of the 'Banc Villageois' of SINOU KHALY Mrs. Fatim G., standing on the right in the photo, is head of the group. She is 59, married, the mother of two children and is also raising another child who was confided to her husband. She has been selling couscous to earn a living for almost 10 years. Her loan will allow her to buy millet to make into couscous to sell in her village. The profit from her business will help her pay for food for her family and also for medical expenses in case of illness.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of millet to make into couscous

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr:
Monique T. est une femme de 51 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de LEKHAR depuis 2007. Elle a 6 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit auprès de CAURIE MICRO FINANCE et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement.

Elle fait de l'élevage de poulets de chaire comme activité principale. Et comme activité secondaire elle fait un petit commerce de draps de lit et de tissus.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter des poussins et des produits véto pour l'élevage de poulet de chair et pour le petit commerce elle achètera des draps de lit et des tissus.

Avec ses bénéfices elle compte participer de la nourriture pour sa famille, payer éventuellement des frais de soin en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Monique T. is a 51-year old woman. She is single without children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Lekhar since 2007. Since joining, she obtained loans from Caurie Microfinance six times and never had any problems repaying them. Her main business activity is raising broiler chickens. As a secondary activity, she sells bed linen and fabrics. With this loan she would like to purchase baby chicks and chicken feed needed for raising broiler chickens, and for her small retail business she would like to purchase some bed linen and fabrics. With the resulting revenues, she would like to provide for her family’s food as well as for healthcare expenses in case of future illness.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chicks, feed, bed linens and cloth

loans.name: Maria Rosalba

texts.es:
María Rosalba B. A. es una  mujer dedicada a trabajar la lencería, un oficio que su naturaleza le permitió desarrollar, porque desde muy pequeña ayudaba a su mamá, en hacer dobladillos y pegar botones y a ella desde siempre le ha gustado hacerlo. Porque  es que la costura es un arte, que en su familia viene de generación en generación,   porque  su abuela también confeccionaban prendas de vestir sin ir al la academia  a estudiar este arte. 

María vive en el barrio ciudadela 20 de Julio y tiene 3 hijos que ha educado muy bien en su condición de separada de su esposo, con el que lleva muy buenas relaciones y que ha asumido siempre la responsabilidad de sus hijos.  María una vez vivió el duelo de la separación, se refugió en la costura  “fue como su  terapia ocupacional” y justamente en ese momento una  buena vecina y amiga que le vio su potencial y conocía que María no tenia dinero para preparase técnicamente en ese arte, le empezó a enseñar cada clase de costura que ella aprendía en una academia; así fue como se dedicó a hacer colchas, fundas, cortinas y en general productos de lencería y arreglos que adornan los baños, las paredes y la cocina de los hogares. Ella en su maquina familiar, regalo de su madre hace muchos años, trabaja la costura, aunque aun tiene que ir donde una prima a pulir la prenda mediante su fileteadora, pues ella no tiene la suya propia. Aunque conoce su oficio perfectamente desde hace 5 años ella empieza a ver esta actividad como una forma de generar importantes ingresos y por eso agradece a su amiga que le enseño a costear y también a trabajar en lo que a ella mas le gusta. 

Su negocio ha avanzado mucho porque en un principio ahorraba de lo que le mandaba su esposo y sus hijo que trabajan y ahora con sus propios ingresos puede comprar telas e insumos y darle respuesta a pedidos que hacen sus clientes. En la actualidad solicita un credikiva a la Fundación Mario Santo domingo para comprar una maquina collarina  y una fileteadora  y perfeccionar desde sus instalaciones lo que mas le gusta hacer: su trabajo de lencería.
texts.en:
María Rosalba B. A. is a woman who works in lingerie. Her nature allowed her to develop this business. Since she was very little she would help her mother make hems and sew on buttons and she always liked doing it. Sewing is an art, and in her family it has been passed down from generation to generation. Her grandmother also made clothing without attending the academy to study the art. María lives in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood and she has 3 children that she has brought up very well while separated from her husband. She gets along very well with him and he has always taken responsibility for his children. Once Maria was living with the pain of the separation, she took refuge in sewing: "it was like occupational therapy". Just then, a good neighbor and friend who saw her potential and knew that Maria didn't have any money to study this art technically, began to teach her sewing classes that she has learned at the academy. This was how she began to make blankets, pillowcases, curtains and general lingerie products and bathroom, wall, and kitchen home decor arrangements. She sews with her familiar sewing machine, a gift from her mother from many years ago. She has to go to her cousin's overlocking machine, since she doesn't have her own. Although she knows her profession perfectly well, for five years she has begun to see this activity as a way to generate important income and this is why she is grateful to her friend who taught her to sew and also to work at what she likes the best. Her business has advanced a lot because at the beginning she would save what her husband and her children who work sent to her and now with her own income she can buy fabric and materials to repsond to the orders her customers make. Presently she is asking for a KIva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a collar machine and an overlocker and to perfect her facilities for what she likes to do the most: her lingerie work.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A collar machine and an overlacker to perfect her facilities for what she likes to do the most: her lingerie work.

loans.name: Nathalie Angele

texts.fr:
Nathalie Angèle T. est une femme de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de LEKHAR depuis 2004 et a 13 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit auprès de CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. 

Elle pratique depuis plus 5ans un petit commerce de tissus et de bijoux. Elle dispose d'une bonne clientèle dans son village et dans les villages environnants. 

Son nouveau prêt de 500.000 francs CFA lui permettra d'acheter des tissus et bijoux en grande quantité pour escompter plus de bénéfices.  

Nathalie Angèle T. est soutien de sa famille maternelle, ses bénéfices lui permettront de participer en grande partie à la prise en charge de la nourriture de ladite famille maternelle.
texts.en:
Nathalie Angèle T., 35, is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" of LEKHAR since 2004, has received 13 consecutive loans from CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE, and has always reimbursed them without difficulty. For more than five years she has been involved in a small business selling cloth and costume jewelry. She has a good clientele in her village and in the surrounding villages. Her new loan in the amount of 500,000 francs CFA will allow her to buy large quantities of cloth and jewelry so as to benefit from a reduced cost to her and thus make more profit. Nathalie Angèle T. helps support her mother's family; her profit will go a long way toward allowing her to cover the expense of feeding her mother's family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cloth and costume jewelry for resale

loans.name: Houndjiho

texts.fr: Née en 1967, A. Houndjiho vit depuis une quinzaine d'année au quartier Dégakon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Houndjiho est mariée à HOUESSOU ABO Jérémie et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Houndjiho vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Dégakon. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Houndjiho n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Houndjiho vend des produits de mer (poissons frais, etc.) au Port de pêche à Cotonou. Houndjiho achète également ses produits au port de pêche. Houndjiho exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans environs et a déjà obtenu cinq crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés à ALIDé. En vue de renforcer son activité et de rehausser son stock de produits de mer, Houndjiho sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1967, Houndjiho A. has been living for about 15 years in the Dégakon neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Jérémie HOUESSOU ABO and the mother of three school-attending children. The couple has another child to support. Houndjiho lives together with her children and husband in Dégakon. The couple jointly provides for the family. Houndjiho never attended school. To provide for herself, she sells seafood (fresh fish, etc.) at the Cotonou fishing port, where she also purchases her supplies. She's been running this business for about 15 years, and already benefited from five loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were all repaid without problems. In order to bolster her business and increase her stock of seafood, Houndjiho is seeking a new loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seafood (fish, etc.)

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Las Emprendedoras” tiene  más D. 1 año  D. formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría D. sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas. 
Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación. 
Así todas procuran para salir adelante, una D. las integrantes es la señora Paulina quien se dedica a la venta D. ropas.
Ella venD. sus ropas en forma ambulante visitando a clientes o en ocasiones  ofrece en lugares específicos dentro del mercado D. Asunción.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra D. ropas como camperas, pantalones, buzos,  remeras y otros.
texts.en:
The committee "Las Emprendedoras" has been formed for more than a year with Fundación Paraguaya. The majority of their members undertake lucrative activities. They yearn for a better future for their children and it is for this reason that they double their efforts to give their children the materials for their development and education. All of them are trying to do something to move forward. One of the members, Paulina, works selling clothes. She sells them door to door visiting clients and on occasions offering them in specific locations within the Asunción market. She is seeking a loan to purchase more clothes such as jackets, pants, track suits, t-shirts and others.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Kene

texts.fr:
KENE D. est âgée de 64 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. elle est membre du banc villageois de LEKHAR depuis le 19 décembre 2006 et a 8 fois de suite reçu du crédit auprès de CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de pâte d'arachide et de céréales locales. (mil, sorgho et maïs) 

Avec son prêt elle achète de la pâte d'arachide, des céréales locales. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages environnants pour revendre dans son village?

Avec les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité elle achète de la nourriture pour sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Kene D. is 64. She is married and has six children. She has been a member of the banc villageois of Lekhar since December 19, 2006, and has had eight previous loans from CAURIE Micro Finance. She has a small business selling peanut butter and local cereal grains (millet, sorghum and corn). She will use this loan to buy more of her products in neighboring villages to sell in her own village. The profits from her business enable her to feed her family and save more.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy peanut butter and local cereal grains

loans.name: Alonso Rodrigo

texts.es:
Alonso de 45 años, , vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), el tiene un taller de metales es maestro cerrajero el aprendió desde pequeño cuando  papa le enseño para que pueda tener sus propios ingresos.   

Cuando comenzó a ser cerrajero tuvo que trabajar muy duro para poder tener el taller en su casa, poco a poco compro los materiales y las maquinas, ahora el taller lo tiene en la parte delantera de su casa para mas facilidad. Trabaja desde las 08:30 hasta las 17h00pm. El tiene tres hijos el mayor le ayuda en el taller. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina soltadora y suministros para su negocio, en el futuro quiere tener mas grande su taller y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Alonso, 45, lives in the Perimetral de Guayaquil (a semi-urban zone surrounded by a salty marsh). He has a metal workshop and is a master lock-smith, learning the trade when he was little when his father taught him so he could earn his own income. When Alonso began being a locksmith he had to work very hard to be able to have a workshop in his house. Little by little he purchased the materials and machines, and now he has a workshop at the front of his house. He works from 8.30 in the morning until 5pm. Alonso has 3 older children who help him in his workshop. With this loan he wants to purchase a soldering iron and gas supplies. In the future he wants to expand his workshop and finish building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a welding iron and gas supplied

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: D. Juliette est née le 18 Mai 1967 au Mono. Juliette n'est pas mariée mais a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Juliette vit seule depuis deux ans à Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Juliette vend des chaussures et également des tenues (friperies) dans son quartier. Juliette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Lomé au Togo. Juliette exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et a déjà bénéficié de quatre prêts à ALIDé, prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Juliette désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et accroître davantage sa clientèle et par ricochet son chiffre d'affaire. C'est pourquoi Juliette sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Juliette D. was born on May 18, 1967, in Mono. She's unmarried but has two school-attending children. For two years, she's been living alone in Agla in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. To provide for herself, Juliette sells shoes and second hand clothing in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin, as well as in Lomé, Togo. Juliette has been running this business for five years, and already obtained four loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. All loans were repaid without problems. She would like to bolster her business and increase her clientele and, consequently, her revenue. This is why she's seeking another loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothing

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: A. Juliette est née en Novembre 1959 et vit depuis cinquante et un an à Enagnon, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Juliette est mariée à DABOUTON Latifou et est mère d'un enfant. Le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Juliette subvient avec son mari aux différentes charges de la famille. Juliette n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Juliette vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce aux poissons, etc.) à Cotonou. De façon secondaire, Juliette vend des produits de brasserie (boissons). Juliette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et dans les dépôts de Cotonou. Juliette exerce cette activité depuis trois ans et a déjà obtenu un prêt qu'elle a bien remboursé. Juliette désire élever le niveau de son activité et augmenter sa production, pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pour cette raison que Juliette sollicite un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Juliette A. was born in November, 1959 in Enagnon, a neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she's been living for 51 years. She's married to Latifou DABOUTON, and the mother of one child. The couple has two other children to support. Juliette provides for the family with her husband. Juliette only attended elementary school. To provide for herself and for her children, she sells food (corn paste with fish sauce, etc.) in Cotonou. As a secondary business, she also sells beer. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin, and in warehouses in Cotonou. Juliette has been running this business for three years, and already obtained a loan, which she repaid without problem. She would like to bolster her business and increase her production, in order to better meet customer demand. This is why she's seeking a second loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, condiments for sauce, fish, and peanut oil

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchadoras nace hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
En los dos años han pasado por muchas cosas para mantener unido al grupo especialmente en cuanto al  cumplimiento de pagos pero todas asumieron el compromiso de levantar nuevamente y con éxito el comité al cual pertenecen.
Actualmente continúan trabajando con mucho empeño para sacar adelante a su comité una de las integrantes es la señora Rossana quien se dedica  a la peluquería en un salón que posee en su casa.
Ella se dedica a esta profesión desde muy joven y de esa manera siempre ayudó a su familia.
Con cada crédito que solicita ella invierte en el mejoramiento de su salón, en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para compra de un sillón para peluquería.
texts.en:
The committee 'Mujeres Luchadoras' was born over 2 years ago by means of negotiation and support from another committee that works in the same place. In these 2 years many things have happened to keep the group united, especially with regard to making repayments, and all have assumed responsibility to rise again and with great success. They all continue working with great determination to move forward. One of the members is Rossana, who works as a hairdresser in a salon she has in her house. She has been working in this profession since she was very young and has always helped her family. She invests each loan in the improvement of her salon. On this occasion the loan is to purchase an armchair for the salon.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an armchair

loans.name: Marteriano

texts.es: El Sr. Marteriano se dedica a la venta de productos de  limpieza como detergentes, champús y otros de esta línea se dedica a esta actividad ya desde hace dos años y le va bien en el negocio, ya cuentan con un vehículo que compraron en sociedad con su hermano,  debido a que le ofrecieron comprarse una caseta para la venta de sándwiches se apersono para solicitar el crédito, tiene una familia reducida que esta compuesta por su esposa y su hijito de 3 años, tienen deseos de superarse, para lo cual piensan comprar la caseta y su esposa hacerse cargo de la elaboración y venta de sándwiches, esta muy agradecido con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgación del credito
texts.en:
Senor Marteriano works selling cleaning products, such as detergents, shampoos and others in this line. He has been doing this activity for 2 years and his business is going well as he now has a vehicle which he purchased together with his brother. He has been offered to purchase a cart to sell sandwiches so is seeking a loan. He has a small family composed of his wife and small son, 3. They want to improve their situation and are thinking of buying the cart, with his wife taking charge of making and selling the sandwiches. He is thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cart to sell sandwiches

loans.name: Manantial De Vida Group

texts.es: Doña Clediberta es una social que ha trabajado durante varios años con nosotros inicio su negocio cuando trabajo en Patzicia, hoy en día su negocio venta de ropa típica ha crecido y por lo tanto necesita tener mas mercaderia, también tiene la idea de poner una venta de papas fritas para incrementar sus ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su hijo que aún depende de ella, por otro lado esta Doña Sofia que también tiene una venta de ropa típica pero desea que la misma este mas surtida, y finalmente esta Doña Ana que también tiene una venta de ropa tipíca ella si no cuenta con un puesto ni local, y se dedica a hacer su venta de casa en casa ofreciendo su producto, ella también desea surtir mas su mercaderia.
texts.en:
Clediberta has worked with us for several years. She started her business when she worked in Patzicia. She now sells traditional clothing in her business. Her business has grown, and that is why she needs to have more merchandise. She also plans to start selling potato chips so she can increase her income and be able to get ahead with her son, who is dependent on her. Also in the group is Sofia, who sells traditional clothing as well and wants her business to be better stocked. Finally, there is Ana, who also sells traditional clothing. She doesn’t have a stand or premises for her business, but makes a living selling her products door-to-door. She also wants to stock up more on her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise for their traditional clothing businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. María se dedica al comercio de abarrotes en el pasaje atacama de la ciudad de Quillacollo, atiende desde muy temprano ya que el flujo de clientes es mayor durante las  mañanas, su familia esta compuesta por su esposo quien trabaja como empleado en la fabrica de refrescos Salvietty, y sus dos  hijos  de 16 años y su hija de 12 años que se encuentran en secundaria, la señora se dedico al comercio ya que como ella indica el dinero no alcanza y tienen que trabajar ambos. Además debido a que se acerca la fiesta de la Virgen de Urkupiña una fiesta muy tradicional de la ciudad de Cochabamba donde viene gente de todo el mundo a visitar a la virgencita de Urkupiña ya que le tienen mucha fe por ser muy milagrosa y estas fechas  hay mayor movimiento en Quillacollo y se necesita mas capital para surtir su tienda comprar productos como arroz, fideo, refrescos, dulces, galletas, velas, etc. La Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito..
texts.en:
Sra. María sells groceries along the Atacama corridor in the city of Quillacollo. She opens for business very early since the flow of customers is higher in the mornings. Her family consists of her husband, who is employed at the Salvietty soft drink factory, their two 16 year old sons, and their 12 year old daughter, all of whom are in secondary school.

María started her business because she did not have enough money and both she and her husband needed to work. Approaching is the festival of the Virgin of Urkupiña, a traditional holiday in the city of Cochabamba when people from all over the world come to visit. Those who have great faith offer prayers to the Virgin of Urkupiña in hopes of experiencing miracles. Quillacollo is extremely busy during this time, so María needs more capital to restock her store. She plans to buy products such as rice, noodles, soft drinks, candy, cookies, candles, and other items. Sra. María is a hardworking individual. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mujeres Renovadoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Señora Mónica Gómez quien es  vendedora de cosméticos del Barrio Las Garzas.
Ella recorre a pie todo el barrio por la mañana y por la tarde levantando pedidos entre  los vecinos.
Cuando se enteró de  los creditos para mujeres que ofrecia la Fundación se interesó y comenzó a formar el comité con  sus vecinas,  y actualmente ya ayudo mucho los creditos obtenidos a ella y a su grupo.
Ellas trabajan constantemente y realizan reuniones periodicamente en el domicilio de la Señora Mónica Gómez una señora muy activa, trabajadora. 
La señora Mónica solicita el crédito para la compra de perfume, maquillajes, cremas y otros.
Todas las integrantes son mujeres que siguen adelante con su esfuerzo y agradecen a la Fundación por ayudarlas  con el trabajo que tienen para poder sobrellevar a sus hijos y a ellas mismas.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Sra. Mónica Gómez who is a cosmetics saleswoman in the neighborhood of Las Garzas. She travels by foot around the neighborhood in the mornings and afternoons taking orders from her neighbors. When she learned about the loans for women that were being offered by Fundación Paraguaya, she became interested and started to form a committee with her neighbors. Today the loans have been a great help to her and to the rest of her group. They work constantly and conduct periodic meetings at the home of Sra. Mónica Gómez who is an active hardworking woman.

Sra. Mónica is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, make-up, crèmes, and other products. All of the members are women who want to continue making progress through their efforts. They thank Fundación Paraguaya for helping them with their work so that they can press forward along with their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, make-up, crèmes, and other products

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros de la Provincia de Vinto a Cochabamba, la ciudad Cercado desde hace dos años, es de aquellas personas que se fueron a Europa a probar suerte y no fue como el esperaba, volvió al País y de vuelta a encontrarse con su cruda realidad, También su esposa se encontraba allá,  el volvió primero y luego su esposa quien tiene documentos de radicatoria, pero a ruegos y llantos de sus hijas prefirieron la familia antes que el dinero. Con el dinero que se trajeron de allá se compraron el Minibús y la esposa se dedico al comercio y para mejorar la tiendita decidieron construir  una más amplia. Para lo que solicitaron el préstamo compraran cemento, pintura, etc. Son muy trabajadores y cabe recalcar que para ellos es primero la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilfredo has been transporting passengers from the Province of Vinto to the enclosed city of Cochabamba for two years. He was one of many people who moved to Europe to try his luck, but when things did not work out as expected, he returned to Bolivia to face a harsh reality. Wilfredo also met his wife in Europe, so he returned first and she followed thereafter once she had filed her documents. After experiencing the prayers and tears of their daughters, Wilfredo and his wife chose to remain a family over seeking fortune.

Using the money he brought back with him, he bought a minibus while his wife started a retail business. To improve her tiny shop, they decided to build a bigger one. For this reason, Wilfredo is requesting a loan to buy cement, paint, and other materials. They are hard workers and emphasize that for them the family unit comes first.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build his wife's store

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a member of Tumaini Kabuku group under Faulu Kenya. For seven years, he has been operating a retail shop and, besides that, he rears poultry and cows for commercial use.

Benard is glad to be associated with Faulu Kenya because he can easily access loans. He previously serviced a loan of 40,000 KES which he used to boost his business. He has requested another loan of 80,000 KES to purchase a calf and also a motorbike for transporting his goods.

Benard hopes to expand his business in the future so as to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase a calf as well as a motorbike for transporting his goods

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is 35 years old and is married with two children aged 3 and 1. He has been selling electrical goods for ten years. He was previously employed and went into business so as to earn enough income to support his family.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Johnstone has been able to save his money. He has also become focused in his business and, so far, he has managed to employ two people.

Johnstone has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to add to his stock of electrical goods for resale.

loans.use: To add to his stock of electrical goods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joaquin Gabriel

texts.es: El Joven Joaquín es de aquellos jóvenes  que tiene la idea de comprarse todo lo necesario antes de casarse, ya que como el lo dice, después es difícil, el es soltero pero el mas responsable dentro la casa como dijo su madre, quien le recomendó unas tres veces que el sacar crédito es una gran responsabilidad y que hay que cumplir , Joaquín se dedica al transporte como chofer desde hace ya mas de dos años y además se dedica a estudiar mecánica, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para comprar un refrigerador para su Mama y con  el dinero que le sobre ayudara a su madre ya que ella es de la tercera edad, es muy trabajador y esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Joaquín is a young man who believes in the idea of acquiring everything that is needed before getting married because he claims it will be difficult afterwards. Even though he is single, his mother says he is very responsible around the house. She recommended on three occasions that he apply for a loan since it is a great responsibility that he is capable of completing.

Joaquín has been working in the transportation sector as a chauffeur for more than two years and is also studying to become a mechanic. Some of the money from this loan will be used to buy a refrigerator for his mother, while the rest of it will be set aside to help her since she is elderly. Joaquín is a hard worker and is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator for his mother & provide her with financial support

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Rosmery quien desde hace quince años se dedica a la actividad de la venta de comida es ya muy conocida en la zona, tiene ya mucha  clientela que acude a ella por el buen sazón que le pone a sus platos,  es casad y su  esposo trabaja en la empresa Pil, tiene cuatro hijos, necesitan el capital ya que se aproxima una fiesta local y hay que comprar mas mercadería de la que regularmente necesita con el dinero del credito comprara refrescos, azucar aceite, arroz y fideo para la elaboracion de sus platillos, anteriormente tenia un crédito en grupo razón por la que ahora quiere sacar el crédito  individual ya que según ella el crédito en grupo es muy problemático ya que en muchos casos tienen que pagar deudas de sus compañeras,esta muy agradecida con la institucion por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosmery has been selling food for fifteen years and is well-known in the area. She has many customers who come to her seeking the wonderful flavor of her dishes. Rosmery is married and her husband works for Pil, a Bolivian dairy company. They have four children.

Rosmery needs capital to acquire more products that she uses regularly because of an upcoming local festival. She will use the money to buy soft drinks, sugar, oil, rice, and noodles for making her dishes. Rosmery previously participated in a group loan, but she now wants to obtain an individual loan because she encountered problems with having to pay for other members who were not able to meet their obligations. She is extremely grateful to Emprender for providing this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & ingredients used in preparing her dishes

loans.name: Pacajes Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “PACAJES” está conformada por ocho personas, siete mujeres y un varón, este es su ciclo Nº2. La asociación es parte del centro focal de Cascada, la presidenta es la señora Lizarda Ramirez.  

La señora Lizarda, socia de 37 años de edad, es madre de cuatro niños, actualmente tiene como negocio la elaboración de bordados para la policía, de acuerdo a pedido. 

Ingresó a Pro Mujer por invitación de una amiga.   El crédito le servirá para aumentar el capital de trabajo. Compra los insumos de una tienda en la “Ceja” que se encuentra en la ciudad de El Alto.

Conversando con la presidenta comenta que lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer son los servicios de salud y capacitación.

En cuanto a la asociación comunal, tienen diferentes tipos de negocios de servicio y comercio, como ser, punto de servicio de teléfono público, venta de carne, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, Taxista, Venta de comida y artesanía, servicio de Internet y fotocopiadora, venta en kiosco refresco – chicles – punto de servicio de teléfono público.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Pacajes” consists of eight individuals, seven women and one man. They are in their second loan cycle. This group is part of the Cascada Community Center. The group president is Sra. Lizarda Ramirez.

Sra. Lizarda is 37 years old and the mother of four children. She currently has a business making embroideries for the police upon request. Lizarda joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend. The loans have allowed her to increase her operating capital. She buys her supplies from a shop located on the outskirts of the city of El Alto.

Speaking in her role as President, Lizarda says what she likes most about Pro Mujer are the health services and the training classes.

The members of this Communal Association engage in different service and retail businesses offering public phone services, meat, clothing, fruit, taxi services, food, handicrafts, Internet service, photocopying services, soft drinks, and chewing gum.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics in different colors

loans.name: Diambari Djiguen Gni Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DIAMBARI DJIGUEN GNI est le 28 janvier 2009. Il est composé de 11 femmes habitant la même concession. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de SINOU KHALY

Madame Nogoye M. debour sur la photo en deuxième position à partir de la droite (son visage est mis en médaillon en bas de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Elle fait du petit commerce: vente de produits divers, manioc, balais, huile végétale etc..

Son crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en grande quantité en marchandises énumérées ci-dessus. 

Son objectif est de soutenir mon mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, par l'achat de ravitaillement pour la nourriture. Chaque mois elle elle verse une épargne au niveau de son Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The Diambari Djiguen Gni solidarity group was formed on January 28, 2009. It is made up of 11 women, all residents of the same neighborhood. The group forms part of the banc villageois of Sinou Khaly. Mme Nogoye M. (standing second from right in the photo; head and shoulders shot in the small photo) is the group's leader. She is 45 and married with four children. In her small business she sells a variety of products (cassava, brooms, vegetable oil, etc.). Her loan will allow her to stock more of these products. Her objective is to help her husband support their family by buying food for them. Each month, she makes a deposit to her savings account at her banc villageois.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cassava, brooms and vegetable oil

loans.name: Martha Natalia

texts.es: La Señora Martha comerciante de ropa desde hace cuatro años, solicita el monto para comprar ropa en la ciudad de la Paz y comercializarlo en las distintas ferias de Cochabamba, conocedora del mercado esta cambiando del comercio de ropa  de adultos al de niños. Vive en domicilio de un conocido quien le confió la casa para que lo administrara, pagando los servicios  y cobrando los alquileres de los inquilinos, tiene una hija que vive con ella pero quien según doña Martha se va  a ir, ya que se va a casar. Doña Martha ya saco doce créditos en la institución y cuenta con buen historial crediticio es cliente antigua, muy trabajadora y responsable, esta muy agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad que le brinda durante todo este tiempo.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha has been a clothing merchant for the past four years. The amount she is requesting will be used to buy clothes in the city of La Paz so that she can sell them at different fairs in Cochabamba. She is aware that the market for adult and children’s clothing is changing.

Martha lives in a house owned by an acquaintance who entrusted her with it. She is also in charge of paying the utilities and collecting rent from the other tenants. Even though her daughter lives with her, Doña Martha says she will be leaving soon to get married. Martha has already had twelve loans with Emprender and has built up a good credit history as a long-time client. She is hardworking and responsible. Martha says she is grateful to Emprender for all the opportunities that have been provided to her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more clothing

loans.name: Victor Osmar

texts.es:
El  solicitante es el Sr. Víctor M. el mismo está acompañado  tiene una hija de 6 meses vive en casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar.
El Mismo es microempresario se dedica a la venta  ambulante por la zona de Encarnación ,Cambyreta ha solicitado el crédito para comprar de mercaderías  como ser harina, aceite, yerba, azúcar, combustible de  Posadas Argentina, las mercaderías son más baratas y le dejan mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
This applicant is Sr. Victor M.. He lives with his six month old daughter in his own home that is equipped with all the necessary comforts.

This micro-entrepreneur is a traveling vendor in the area of Encarnación, Cambyreta. He is requesting a loan in order to buy goods such as flour, oil, herbs, sugar, and fuel. Victor acquires his merchandise in Posadas, Argentina, where the prices are much cheaper. This enables him to have a higher profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, oil, herbs, sugar, and fuel

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Señora Julia nacida el 23 de Junio de 1954 en Chuquisaca(Monteagudo), con 2 hijos con viviente con don Primitivo hace 10 años que tiene su tierra en Betanzo a 35 Km de Limoncito en la cual se dedican a la agricultura juntamente con su esposo y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en la simbra, cosecha y el la comercializacion de los productos en el mercado del Torno y tambien en los mercados de Santa Cruz,Ella hace 4 años que trabaja con Emprender, con el mdinero del credito comprara una motosierra y para mano de obra para la cosecha de frutas como la sandia, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado, en la foto la Sra. Julia esta acompañada con su Esposo.
texts.en:
Julia, was born in Chuquisaca (Monteagudo), on June 23, 1954. She lives with her husband, Primitivo, and her two children. For 10 years, she has had her land in Betazon, 35 kilometers from Limoncito, where she, her husband, and children, who help them, raise, harvest, and sell their products in the markets in Torno and Santa Cruz. She’s been working with Emprender for four years and will use the money from this loan to buy a motorbike and to pay for labor to harvest fruits, such as watermelon. She is very grateful to the institution for the support it has given her. Julia is accompanied by her husband in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorbike and labor

loans.name: Julieta Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Julieta se dedica a la compra y venta de vestidos para niñas y jovencitas, tiene ya 13 años en esta actividad, lo compra de su hermana que los confecciona y los vende en las zonas comerciales de la ciudad de La Paz, vive en anticrético en Bajo Pampahasi, con su esposo y sus hijos que están estudiando. La Sra. es una cliente muy responsable, ya que trabaja con nosotros en un grupo solidario, es una cliente antigua. El crédito que solicita ahora es para la compra de vestidos bordados, ya que le hicieron ese pedido ya que estos vestidos tienen mucha demanda, la Sra. es  muy trabajadora y responsable, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por  la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Julieta buys and sells young ladies’ and girls’ clothing and has been doing this for 13 years. She buys the clothing from her sister, who makes it, and sells it in the commercial areas of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband and children, in an “anticrético” apartment, in Bajo Pampahasi. Her children attend school. (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter.
