If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.) [Julieta] is a very responsible client, and part of a united group, who’s been working with us for some time. She will use the money from this loan to buy embroidered dresses, since she has had some requests and these types of dresses are in high demand. She is very hard working and responsible and is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the opportunity they have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaías tiene 41 años. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es un taller de carpintería. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza con Fundación por lo que se siente muy agradecido. Siempre está trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y con deseo de salir adelante. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad, pues sus inicios se dan desde muy joven ya que su Papa tenía un taller y él le enseño este medio de trabajo sus trabajos son muy importantes pues la elaboración de sillas, comedores, cama, puertas y roperos son lo que sus clientes más solicitan. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de madera y ciertas herramientas que son necesarias en su taller.
texts.en:
Isaías is 41 years old and has a carpentry shop. This will not be his first loan through Fundación and he is very grateful. He is constantly working and makes a great effort and has a great desire to get ahead. He’s been doing this for more than 11 years. As a boy, his father had his own carpentry shop and he taught [Isaías] the art. His jobs are important and include the manufacture of chairs, dining room tables, beds, doors, and armoires. These are the things that his customers request most from him. He will use the money from this loan to buy lumber, and some tools that he needs for his work shop.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vicenta Irene

texts.es:
Vicenta de 48 años, Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene un restaurante, utiliza su casa para cocinar los platos típicos.   

Ella comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de ingresos, y para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Invirtió sus ahorros en víveres y comenzó a hacer comidas en su casa y venderlas a sus vecinos y amigos. Desde esos tiempos hasta ahora ella ha vendido almuerzos y meriendas desde $ 1.25 hasta $ 1.50.

Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar una cocina con el préstamo y mesas para mas comida. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 48 years old and lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil (an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants). She cooks typical dishes in her house. She started this activity because she did not have income. She started in order to be able to support her children because she is a single mother. She invested her savings in ingredients to make her dishes at her house and sell them to her friends and neighbors. Ever since she started she has been selling lunches and snacks for $1.25-$1.50. In order to continue in the business she wants to use the loan to buy a stove and tables for more food. In the future she wants her business to grow and her children to finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plastic tables and a stove

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La Sra.  Máxima tiene 58 años y tiene una despensa en Mariano Roque Alonso en su casa propia.
Tiene dos hijos todos ellos ya mayores.
La señora Maxima tiene su negocio en el centro de la ciudad y cuenta con todos los articulos de primera necesidad en exposión para la ventas.
Ella comenta que el negocio es el sosten de su familia ya que es madre soltera y trabaja mucho para una buena administracion de su negocio.
Agradece a la Fundación por darle la oportunidad de acceder a un crédtito para poder surtir mas su Despensa con azúcar, harina, fideo, arroz, aceite, bebidas en general y otros.
texts.en:
Máxima is 58 years old and has a store in her home, located in Mariano Roque Alonso. She has two children who are already grown. Maxima's store is in the city center and has a wide range of staple goods on display for sale. She comments that her business is the source of support for her family, since she is a single mother and works hard to run her business effectively. She is grateful to the Foundation for giving her the opportunity to obtain a loan, which she will use to expand her store's inventory with sugar, flour, noodles, rice, cooking oil, various beverages, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sugar, flour, rice, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: By farming materials like organic and chemical fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Bayardo Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Bayardo  Enrique V. R., tiene la edad de 66 años es casado y su esposa realiza las actividades del hogar, ellos tienen 8 hijos mayores de edad y que laboran en diferentes actividades, y apoyan a sus padres en los gastos que se incurren mensualmente.

Fue gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres que lograron iniciarse en la actividad de agricultura, siendo esta su fuente de ingreso que sustentó todos estos años a toda la familia, es para la finca que ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, que permitan un mejor mantenimiento a las cosechas, y la posibilidad de mejorar sus condiciones económicas y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Bayardo Enrique V. R. is 66 years old and married. His wife does the household chores. They have 8 older children that work in different businesses and support their parents with the expenses that they incur each month.

It was thanks to the effort of his parents that they were able to begin working in agriculture, this being the source of income that supported the family all of these years. He is requesting this loan for the farm to purchase agricultural materials, which will allow for better care for the crops and the possibility to improve his economic conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining crops

loans.name: Jose Gonzalo

texts.es:
José de 44 años,  Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene un puesto de venta de verduras y frutas. 

Cuando comenzó  tuvo que trabajar muy duro para poder tener su puesto de verduras, poco a poco compro vegetales, verduras, legumbres, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora el tiene un puesto y una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa para mas facilidad. Trabaja desde las 07:00 hasta las 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar verduras y frutas para su negocio, en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
José is 44 years old and has a fruit stand located in the suburbs of Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are part of the informal economy. When he stated, he had to work very hard in order to have his fruit stand. Little by little he bought vegetables, fruits, and beans. Since then he has had a stand and a small store in the front part of his home to make things easy. He works from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm. He will use the money from this loan to buy fruits and vegetables for his business. In the future he would like to expand his business and improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jennifer Esther

texts.es:
Jennifer M. E. es una mujer de mucha actividad productiva, pues  conoce de negocios y día a día se prepara no solo para ser mejor  y adaptarse a los cambios de la vida, sino también para ofrecerle un futuro promisorio a sus tres muy pequeños hijos; usted puede ver a Jennifer  los fines de semana en su casa trabajando en la   elaboración y ventas de comidas rápidas y de lunes a viernes trabaja como empleada de una farmacia ubicada en los interiores en el batallón militar, donde además tiene un potencial de clientes importantes entre los militares y el personal administrativo,  a quienes también les vende mercancías variadas,  como ropa, calzado y cosméticos.  Así combina varias actividades productivas de ingresos con el apoyo y asesoramiento de su madre de quien aprendió a ser una mujer emprendedora y que además está también vinculada a los programas de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Jennifer vive en el barrio carrizal de la ciudad de Barranquilla   en casa de sus  padres con sus tres hijos  que  ha sacado adelante en condición de madre sola. Los resultados positivos y la gran responsabilidad y disciplina  que ha visto  en su  madre ha sido el mayor impulso en la vida  de Jennifer como trabajadora.   Con  su credikiva, que es su cuarto crédito  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor de  $2.000.000 COP ,   compró, (nótese en la fotografía donde aparece el carricoche con su madre), un carricoche especializado de comidas rápidas y el resto lo invirtió en la  compra de insumos y materias primas.  
Como toda mujer emprendedora quiere tener su casa propia para brindarle a sus hijos un buen ambiente familiar e independiente y que en un futuro sean buenos profesionales, ella trabaja mucho de manera independiente y también para una empresa , porque como tiene  muchas ganas de surgir, que se capacita constantemente y por esa razón consiguió un buen trabajo dependiente  en la farmacia  del  batallón de militares.
texts.en:
Jennifer M. E. is a woman of many profitable businesses; she knows business. Each day she prepares to not only improve herself and adapt to life's changes, but also to offer a promising future to her three young children. On weekends, you can find Jennifer working in her house to make and sell fast food. From Monday to Friday, she works as an employee in a pharmacy located inside the military district. The military district also offers the potential of important customers, between the soldiers and the administrative personnel, for her other business, selling various merchandise like clothing, footwear and cosmetics. With support and advice from her mother, from who she learned to be an enterprising woman and who also participates in the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation programs, she combines various profitable business ventures. Jennifer and her three children live in her parents' home in the Carrizal Neighborhood of Barranquilla City. Even as a single mother, she has given her children the chance to get ahead. The positive results earned from great responsibility and discipline that she has seen in her mother have been the greatest driving forces in Jennifer's working life. With her Kiva loan of $2.000.000 COP ($1,100 USD), which is her fourth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she purchased a covered cart specially designed for fast food, (as you can see in the photograph where she appears in the covered cart with her mother). The rest of the money was invested in the purchase of supplies and raw materials. Like all enterprising women, she wants to have her own home in order to offer her children a good, independent family environment and the opportunity to be successful professionals in the future. She works a lot, both independently and also for another business, because she has such a great desire to get ahead. She is constantly training and learning, and that is why she was able to get a good job as a sales clerk in the pharmacy in the military district.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar un carricoche especializado de comidas rápidas y el resto  en la  compra de insumos y materias primas.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El Sr. Alcides Baez de 42 años de edad, es divorciado, el tiene la dicha de tener 5 hijos.
 Don Alcides comenzó con esta profesión  aproximadamente en el año 1997; después de hacer varios cursos consiguió ser egresado de un instituto profesional, seguidamente habilitó un local para ofrecer sus servicios de corte de cabellos para hombres,  en la actualidad sus clientes asisten en forma regular a su negocio;  tiene una buena cantidad de clientela formada.
   El invertirá este crédito en la refacción de su local comercial, para crear un buen ambiente y ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Alcides Baez is 42 years old, divorced, and joyful to be the father of five children. Alcides started his business in 1997, after taking courses and graduating from a professional school. He opened his own barbershop, and today, he has many regular customers. He will use this loan to renovate his barbershop, improve the atmosphere of the place, and offer better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to his business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Señor Juan Carlos es vecino de la zona de Villa Fátima donde esta ubicada nuestra agencia, reside en la zona mas de 25 años, y espera con el tiempo construir una casa de varios pisos para sus hijos, es muy alegre y bromista, antes tenia de negocio la compra venta de vehículos pero fue victima de una estafa, pero supo sobreponerse a este acontecimiento y ahora se esta volviendo a reactivar económicamente, esta feliz por el préstamo que es un apoyo a su trabajo ya que piensa aumentar a la compra de un vehículo , piensa cancelarlo pronto y poder sacar un préstamo mayor, su esposa es un gran apoyo para el, ya que trabaja con la costura, además pronto tendrán un nuevo bebe en casa y están muy contentos por esto.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos has lived in the Villa Fátima neighborhood for more than 25 years and in time, he hopes to build a multilevel home for his children. He is a joyful and funny man. Juan Carlos used to own a business buying and selling used cars. Although he was victim to a scam, he has recovered and is slowly getting back in the business. He is really happy about the loan since it will directly support the purchase of a vehicle. He would like to pay it off soon, so that he can obtain an even bigger loan. Juan Carlos' wife supports him greatly with her work as a seamstress. They are both extremely happy that they will be parents to a new baby soon.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a vehicle

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús C., tiene 38 años de edad vive en San Ignacio, acompañada de sus hijos y su esposo. Él señor labora como soldador tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad que apoyan a los gastos del hogar con sus ingresos mensuales, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 22 años.xzx

Uno de los principales problemas que afectan al negocio es la escases de agua potable que no abastece a su zona, ellos esperan a futuro próximo comprar un tanque de agua con el fin de almacenar para los días en donde no les suministren el vital liquido y convivan sin problema, por ahora solicita un préstamo que les permita la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas y abonos orgánicos que favorezcan a  la siembra y se produzca una mejor cosecha, esta inversión a futuro favorecerá la economía de la familia y les permitirá incursionar a nuevas fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs Teresa de Jesús C., age 38, lives in San Ignacio with her children and husband. Her husband works as a welder. They have 4 grown children who help with the household costs with their monthly earnings. They have been farmers for over 22 years. One of the main problems that affect the business is shortages of potable water which is not supplied to her zone. They hope in the near future to purchase a tank of water to store up for the days when this vital liquid is not supplied. For now they are requesting a loan which will allow them to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and organic fertilizers which are better for planting and produce a better harvest. This investment in the future will improve their family's economic condition and permit them to explore new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of fertilizers, pesticides and organic fertlizers which are better for planting

loans.name: Casildo

texts.es:
El Sr. Casildo O. de 29 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Antonia Espínola de 27 años de edad, ellos tiene la dicha de tener 1 hija.
   Don Casildo comenzó con este rubro  aproximadamente en el año 2008; después de haber estado como empleado durante más de 4 años, juntando poco a poco el dinero de su salario y comprando algunas máquinas.
 Decidió habilitar su taller de chapería y pintura, ya que el tenia todas las herramientas y máquinas necesarias para ofrecer sus servicios;  en la actualidad el trabaja con empresas que se dedica a la venta de autos usados.
   El invertirá este crédito en la compra insumos (masillas, pinturas, material para polarizados, etc.) en cantidad, para abaratar los costos de sus servicios y generar más utilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Casildo O., 29, is married to Ms. Antonia Espínola, 27. They have one daughter. Casildo started his business in 2008. He worked as an employee for more than four years, slowly saving some money and buying some tools. He decided to open his own auto collision repair shop since he already owned the necessary tools to do the work. Today, he works closely with companies that sell used cars. Alcides will use this loan to buy needed materials (paint, window tinting materials, epoxy, etc.) at wholesale prices in order to save money and increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying needed materials for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Pankaritas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “PANKARITAS” está conformada por diez personas, nueve mujeres y un varón, este es su ciclo Nº2. La asociación es parte del centro focal de Collpani, la presidenta es la señora Arminda M. V..  

La señora Arminda M. V., socia de 44 años de edad, casada, madre de 5 niños, actualmente tiene como negocio la elaboración de artesanías en lana de alpaca, en particular mantas de diferentes colores. Lleva adelante esta actividad desde hace 18 años.

Ingresó a Pro Mujer por que recibió la promoción de nuestra institución de parte del personal de la institución.   El crédito le servirá para la compra de una máquina de tejer y lana. Compra los insumos de la ciudad de La Paz, en la calle Max Paredes.

Conversando con la presidenta comenta le gusta de Pro Mujer la reunión con las señoras y la capacitación en salud.

En cuanto a la asociación comunal, tienen diferentes tipos de negocios de servicio y comercio.
texts.en:
The group "Pankaritas" has ten members, nine women and one man, and this is their second cycle with the Collpani community bank. Its president is Ms. Arminda M. V., 44, who is married and the mother of five children. Arminda has been making crafts of alpaca wool, especially blankets of all colors, for the last 18 years. She came to Kiva partner Pro Mujer after seeing some marketing materials from the organization. She will use the loan to buy a knitting machine and some wool. She buys her materials from the city of La Paz. When asked what she loves most about Pro Mujer, Arminda says she likes meeting with the other members, and learning about how to stay healthy. The other Pankaritas' members have different types of businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wool and other materials

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín de 26 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), el tiene una tienda, la mayor parte de sus ventas son legumbre. 

El empezó hace 3 años vendiendo legumbres en el mercado y pescado poco a poco con esfuerzo y la motivación de su esposa alquilo un local y comenzó a vender bebidas, granos, legumbres etc. Ahora el trabaja de lunes a domingo vendiendo en su tienda con ayuda de su esposa. 

Para poder incrementar su negocio el quiere comprar legumbres y bebidas. En el futuro espera comprar un carro para transporta mejor las legumbres.
texts.en:
Efraín is 26 years old and lives in Guayaquil in an urban area where most of the residents own informal businesses. Efraín owns a small business selling vegetables. He started his business three years ago selling vegetables and fish at the market. With the support and encouragement of his wife, he rented a small space from where he started selling beverages, grains, vegetables, etc. He now works every day at his store with the help of his wife. To increase his sales, Efraín wants to buy more vegetables and beverages. In the future, he would like to buy a vehicle to better transport his produce.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beverages and vegetables

loans.name: Marixsa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Marixsa del Carmen B. B., tiene la edad de 40 años vive en el Barrio Las Conchitas, tiene 2 hijos adultos que realizan diferentes actividades de trabajo, pero apoyan a sus padres en los gastos de su hogar. 

Ellos son una familia muy humilde que dentro de sus propios esfuerzos lograron adquirir un casa en la que actualmente habitan, pero que necesita de muchas remodelaciones, y es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, con el firme objetivo de realizar los cambios a su hogar,  esta inversión le permitirá la tranquilidad a los esposo de ofrecerle a sus hijos un hogar más digno, cómodo y seguro donde desarrollar sus vidas y la de su futuras familias.
texts.en:
Miss Marixsa del Carmen B. B., age 40, lives in the Las Conchitas neighbourhood. She has 2 adult children who have different jobs but help their parents with household costs. They are a very humble family who have acquired, through their own efforts, a home in which they now live. However, it needs a lot of remodeling. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of construction materials, with the firm objective of making changes to her home. This investment will give them tranquility and allow them to offer their children a more dignified home, comfortable and secure, where they can develop their lives and those of their future families.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home remodeling

loans.name: Las Azucenas Dobles Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Las Azucenas Dobles” que están ubicadas en Lerma, este grupo se conforma por 11 integrantes, donde se encuentra la señora Senorina G. H. mejor conocida como “Doña Seno”, se dedica  a la venta de servilletas y manteles bordados, nos cuenta la señora Seno que a ella le enseñó su Mama a Bordar desde muy pequeña es por ello que decidió seguir este Arte del bordado, la señora Seno es Madre soltera y tiene tres hijos que son su orgullo y los que la impulsan para salir adelante y poder darles una carrera profesional y que puedan tener una vida mas cómoda. La señora Seno destina su crédito para poder comprar hilos y telas y así realizar más bordados y venderlos entre sus vecinos y algunos clientes que tiene.

En este mismo grupo se encuentra la Señora Teresa V. Q. quien se dedica a la venta de accesorios para automóviles, ella pide el crédito para invertir en material para su negocio, la señora tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y casados, uno de ellos está en la universidad y el más pequeño cursa el segundo año de secundaria, la señora Teresa nos cuenta que el principal motivo de invertir y hacer crecer su negocio, es el poder seguir apoyando los estudios de sus hijos.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
PRESIDENTA: 
Teresa G. B.

TESORERA:    
Martha B. Q.

INTEGRANTES: 
Alicia S. C.
Maribel P. N.
Benita Q. J.
Sonia B. Q.
Luisa B. H.
Edith H. C.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Azucenas Dobles" and is located in Lerma. The group is made up of 11 members, one of whom is Senorina G. H., better known as "Doña Seno". She sells embroidered napkins and tablecloths. Seno says that her mother taught her to embroider when she was very young, and this is the reason that she decided to continue with this art. Seno is a single mother and has three children who are her pride and who drive her to succeed and to be able to make them professionals with a more comfortable life. Seno's loan will be used to purchase threads and fabrics to make more embroidery to sell to her neighbours and some customers. In this same group is Miss Teresa V. Q. who sells accessories for automobiles. She is requesting a loan to invest in material for her business. She has four children, two of whom are grown and married, one of whom is in university and the youngest of whom is in the second year of high school. Teresa tells us that her main incentive to invest and grow her business is to be able to continue to support her children's studies. The other group members are: President: Teresa G. B. Treasurer: Martha B. Q. Members: Alicia S. C. Maribel P. N. Benita Q. J. Sonia B. Q. Luisa B. H. Edith H. C.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in material for their businesses

loans.name: Mujeres Esmeraldeñas ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Esmeraldeñas está formado por un grupo de 9 personas entre hombres y mujeres, quienes buscan en el microcrédito la oportunidad de crecer en sus negocios y mejorar su economía, son oriundos de la provincia de Esmeraldas y ahora vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida  por sus bellos paisajes, su centro histórico, su gastronomía y su gente.

La Señora. Rosa Manogi B. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Esmeraldeñas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, es el primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y ha sido invitada por una amiga a formar parte del banco comunal. Nuestra socia es de la provincia de Esmeraldas, ha venido a la ciudad de Cuenca en busca de una oportunidad de trabajo, se dedica hace 6 años a la venta de camarón, labora los días feriados y fines de semana de 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. 
La Señora Rosa Manogi tiene 42 años, es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos de 25, 23, 20, 19, 13 y 12 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos viven independientemente, su cuarto hijo este año ingresa a la universidad, su quinto hijo está en la escuela debido a que ha perdido el año escolar y su último hijo ingresa este año al colegio, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de camarón. Su sueño es el llegar a tener su casa propia.

La Señora María De Jesús B. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 53 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 32, 29 y 28 años de edad, todos sus hijos son casados y viven  independientemente,  su esposo se dedica a la venta ambulante de ceviche, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Nuestra socia es  de la provincia de Esmeraldas, vive en esta ciudad hace 6 años incentivada por el trabajo y en busca de mejorar su estabilidad económica, se dedica  a la venta de ceviche hace 24 años, vende recorriendo  los mercados de la ciudad de Cuenca, labora de 6 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m., de domingo a domingo. Es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y lo va a invertir en la compra de ostras para sus ceviches. Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank Mujeres Esmeraldeñas ["Women from Esmereldas"] has 9 members, men and women, who are looking to microcredit for the opportunity to expand their businesses and improve their finances. They are all from the province of Esmereldas and now live in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its beautiful countryside, its historical center, its gastronomy and its people. Mrs Rosa Manogi B. is a member of the Mujeres Esmeraldenas. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This is her first loan with the Fundacion and she was invited to be part of the community group by a friend. She is from the province of Esmereldas, and came to the city of Cuenca looking for work. For 6 years she has sold shrimp. She works on holidays and weekends from 7 am to 6 pm. Mrs Rosa Manogi is 42, and a single mother of 6 children ages 25, 23, 20, 19, 13 and 12. Her three oldest children live independently. Her fourth child started university this year, her fifth child is still in primary school since he failed the last grade, and her youngest child is entering high school this year. She does not have her own home because she rents. She will invest this loan in the purchase of shrimp. Her dream is to have her own home. Mrs Maria De Jesus B. lives in the city of Cuenca and is 53. She is in a common-law marriage and has 3 children ages 32, 29 and 28. All of their children are married and live independently. Her husband sells ceviche [citrus-marinated seafood] door to door. They do not have their own home; they rent. She is from the province of Esmeraldas, and has lived in this city for 6 years, motivated by the work and looking to increase her financial stability. She has sold ceviche for 24 years. She sells by going to the markets of the city of Cuenca. She sells from 6 am to 2 pm, every day of the week. This is her first loan with the Fundacion and she will invest it in the purchase of oysters for her ceviches. Her goal is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of shrimp and oysters.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mr. Tha P., age 27, and his wife, Mrs. Silot Uk, age 32 (they are pictured together), have been married since 1999 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of their children attends school and the other two are still young. The family lives in a small village off National Road Number 2 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Tha has been driving a motor taxi for over seven years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years. He hopes to supplement his income with a new business selling pork, but he does not have enough capital. Hence, he is requesting his first loan of $250 to launch the business. He will carry the pork on his motorbike to sell in his village and in the nearby villages.

loans.use: To purchase pork to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Grace has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell.  Grace is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be her second from HSPFI.  Grace plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

-----------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora S., 57, is from the village of Alangilan, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is is married and has 10 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Leonora owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Leonora has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell.  Leonora is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to purchase additional inventory.  This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

---------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Darwen

texts.en:
Darwen P. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 22 years old.  To make a living, Darwen owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  He has been engaged in business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Darwen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darwen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell.  He is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  This loan will be his fourth loan from HSPFI.  He plans to use the additional revenue to expand his business. 

-------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sary O. is a married woman who was born in 1961 and lives in Roneam Tnaot village in Takeo province. She has two children, one of whom is a driver, while the other is attending the local public school. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

Mrs. Sary O. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Net Neang, is a laborer.

Mrs. Sary O.’s problem is that her field is infertile and it is time to plow, but she does not have enough money to support doing so. So, to improve her production of rice, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will rent a plowing machine to plow her field and also pay farm laborers to grow the rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rent a plowing machine and pay farm laborers

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en:
In Pongro village, Takeo province live a couple who are Mrs. Voeurn K. and Mr. Sophen Heng. Mrs. Voeurn K. was born in 1983 and she is a farmer who owns a one-hectare (2.5-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband is an ice cream seller who goes door-to-door and he also operates a recycling business in the rainy season. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

Mrs. Voeurn K.’s problem is that her field is infertile and has a lot of insects. So, to improve her rice production, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. With the rest of the loan, she will buy two pigs for breeding to start a new business.

Mrs. Voeurn K. is the mother of three children who are all studying in the local public school and helping with their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and two pigs

loans.name: Ngim

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngim A. lives in Tang Ruessei village, Takeo province, and she is 47 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Dul Lorn, is a sugar palm seller and he is also a rice wine maker. Her husband is shown with her in the photo. They do not have a child.

Mrs. Ngim A.’s problem is that her field is infertile, but she does not have enough money to support it. So, to improve her rice production, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will rent a plowing machine to plow her field and hire farm laborers to help her to do the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rent a plowing machine and hire farm laborers

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie E. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling onions in the local community.  She also has a little vegetable farm.  Rosie has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom N. lives in Phnum Lonteah village, Takeo province, and she was born in 1972. She is a farmer who owns a three-hectare (7.5-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Moreover, she is also a Khmer cake seller.

Mrs. Mom N.’s difficulty is that her field has infertile soil, but she does not have enough money to support it. So, to improve production, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will rent a plowing machine to plow her field and hire farm laborers to reap her rice field.

Mrs. Mom N. is a widow with two children, both of whom are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rent a plowing machine and hire farm laborers

loans.name: Emerlita

Emerlita L. is from the village of South Cogon in Misamis Oriental Province. She is 46 years old. Emerlita is married and has nine grown children. To make a living, Emerlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for her business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Emerlita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years, and she earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emerlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. Emerlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Emerlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Sarath

texts.en: Mrs. Sarath N., 45 years old, lives in Ta Mouk village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is also a rice middleman while her husband, Mr. Ny Khat, is a pig breeder who also owns a mill in his village. Mrs. Sarath N.'s obstacle is that her field's soil is infertile. To improve rice production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, to rent a plowing machine to plow her field, and to buy pig food. Mrs. Sarath N. is the mother of two children: one is a chef in a shop and the other is a student in the local school.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
From the town of Trento, Maria S., a 49-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also raises hogs for fattening and manages a sari-sari store. Maria says, "I want my family to have a better living standard; that's why I work hard to give it to them."

Maria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new one in the amount of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure, livestock feed, and additional store inventory. Maria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.name: Sariem

She is also a Khmer noodle and Khmer cake seller in her local village while her husband, Mr. Suos Nou, is a construction worker. Her problem is that her field's soil is infertile and it is time to do the farming, but she does not have enough money to support her livelihood. To improve rice production, Mrs. Sariem L. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, to rent a plowing machine to plow her field, to hire farm laborers to grow rice and to buy three piglets and pig food to start a new breeding business. Mrs. Sariem L. is the mother of two children; one attends the local school and the youngest is four years old.

This will be the second loan taken out by Nenita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo que diariamente realiza Ruth en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus sembríos sean uno de los mejores cultivados del poblado de Santa Rosa. Todas las mañanas sale muy temprano a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que es muy importante que tenga sus plátanos y café muy bien cuidados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para tomar sus propias decisiones, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, ya que los sacos en los que los lleva son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera comprar más tierras, para así incrementar su producción. Es el primer crédito con MFP y se siente en la obligación de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y siempre es aconsejada por el resto de las socias. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono, para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Ruth, age 30, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home and her greatest desire is to improve her quality of life. Her daily work is done on her farm. She has made her crops some of the best in the village of Santa Rosa. Every morning she leaves very early to work her land, since she knows that it is very important to have very well-cared for plantains and coffee. What she most likes about her work is the freedom that she has to make her own decisions. She has been doing this job for 10 years and considers the transportation of her crops to be the most difficult aspect, since the bags in which she carries them are very heavy. In the future, she hopes to purchase more land, in order to increase her production. This is her first loan with MFP, and she feels the obligation to repay it on time, since she does not want to cause problems for her community group, where she is very loved and is always advised by other members. With the 1000 soles she is requesting, she will purchase more fertilizer to improve the production of her lands.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Yemina

texts.es: Yemina, de 20 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado cultivar Yemina, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañas comienzan a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de plátano y café, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y abundantes, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de La Merced, que es el lugar donde lo vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores precios. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuota puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Yemina is 20 years old and is a very happy and hardworking young woman. She lives at home with her parents and wishes most to create for herself a good future. The products that Yemina has been able to cultivate with a great deal of effort and dedication have helped her to progress in life. Every morning, she begins working her land, knowing that the care with which she treats the coffee and and banana plants will impact the quality of the crop that results. What Yemina likes most about her job is caring for her crops. She is very happy when she sees them grow tall and abundantly. She has been a farmer for 2 years. Her greatest challenge is transporting the harvest to La Merced market, where she sells her crops, since the sacks of crops are very heavy. In the future, she hopes to improve her products so that she can charge higher prices. This is Yemina's first credit with MFP. She knows that she has to pay all of her installments on time and is prepared to do so. Yemina is a very supportive and responsible member of her community bank. With the 1,000 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase more fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es: Leonora, de 53 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Trabaja vendiendo frutas (plátanos, manzanas, duraznos, mandarinas, uvas, entre otras. Su negocio esta ubicado a la entrada de un mercado de su barrio, en donde acuden sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son amas de casa que gusta de la buena atención que brinda Leonora. En años anteriores en este lugar no brindaba la seguridad ni las condiciones de higiene, pero desde hace 3 años ha cambiado su establecimiento y la seguridad y sanidad que necesita sus compradores.  Se siente muy satisfecha por la por la productividad de su negocio, los fines de semana no se abastece, porque trabaja sola, entonces sus hijos la apoyan en la atención. En adelante le gustaría su negocio con mayor cantidad de frutas y también adquirir un puesto dentro del mercado. Es el quinceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que sabe que le servirá para progresar, asimismo esta satisfecha con el desempeño de sus compañeras de su grupo, ya que son muy responsables. Este dinero que solicita lo invertirá para abastecerse de frutas, de esa manera pueda ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leonora is 53 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and 2 children. She sells fruits (bananas, apples, peaches, mandarins, grapes, etc.) for a living. Her business is located at the entrance of a market in her neighborhood. Her clients are primarily housewives that enjoy the high quality of customer service that Leonara offers. In previous years, this locale did not have sufficient security or cleanliness. However, three years ago, she transformed her establishment so that it now offers the security and hygiene that her clients require. She is very satisfied by the productivity of her business. On the weekends, she does not supply her store because she works alone. Her children help her wait on clients. Going forward, she would like to supply her store with more fruits and also to acquire a stand inside the market. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP. She promises to pay all of her installments on time, since she knows that this will help her future success. She is very satisfied with the performance of the other members of her community bank, since they are very responsible. She will invest the money that she is requesting in supplying her business with more fruit so that she can offer a greater variety of products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fruit for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Loeng Mam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of twenty-two people located I. Roka village, Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Loeng M., who was born I. 1965, as the village bank president. All the members will use their portion of loan I. varied ways to support their businesses.

Mrs. Loeng M. is a farmer who owns a 1.8-hectare (4.5-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vuth Set, is a motorbike taxi driver.

Mrs. Loeng M.’s problem is that her field has infertile soil, and she does not have enough money to farm it. So, to improve her rice production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will rent a plowing machine to plow her field.

Mrs. Loeng M. is the mother of six children, three of whom are seamstresses I. a garment factory, while the others are studying I. the local school.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 55 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. La actividad a la que se dedica, es la preparación y venta de jugos de frutas frescas por las mañanas y por las tardes gaseosas y demás bebidas. Los productos que más demanda tiene son los  extractos de piña y zanahorias, así como jugos de papaya sin azúcar y de otras preparaciones combinados de dos frutas. Atiende todos los días en su establecimiento desde hace 8 años, siendo sus clientes comerciantes del mercado aledaño a su negocio. Lo que más le gusta es trabajar tranquila, además que le resulta rentable, pues lo realiza en su casa y eso le permite estar al pendiente de su familia. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar y diversificar su negocio. Es el quinceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, además dice que le será muy útil para el crecimiento de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar una máquina de moler y exprimir cañas de azúcar, ya que por esta zona no vende este tipo de extracto de fruta.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old and lives in her own house in the company of her husband and her 4 children. Her work is preparing and selling juices made from fresh fruit in the mornings, and in the evenings she sells soft drinks and other beverages. The products in greatest demand are pineapple and carrot juice, as well as papaya juice without sugar and other preparations made from combinations of two fruits. She has worked every day in her business for the past 8 years, and her clients are traders from the market next to her business. What she likes best is working calmly. The business is profitable for her, since she carries it out in her home, and this allows her to be available for her family. Her plans for the future are to expand and diversify her business. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP, and she is committed to making all of her payments on time. She also says that the loan will be very useful for the growth of her business. With the loan she is requesting, she is planning to buy a machine to grind and squeeze juice from sugar cane, since in her area, no one is selling this type of fruit extract.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a machine to grind and squeeze juice from sugar cane

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith P. is from the village of Iniawon in the municipality of Kadingilan in Bukidnon Province. She is 43 years old. Judith is married and has eight school-age children. To make a living, Judith owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 15 years, and she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Judith is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mrs. Sokim Sou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group has fifteen members who live in Trapeang Reang village, Takeo province. Mrs. Sokim S., who was born in 1969, is the village bank president having been selected by the other members. The members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses.

Mrs. Sokim S. and her husband, Mr. Thol Tuon, are farmers who own a half-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land that they use to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Moreover, Mrs. Sokim S. is also a pig breeder.

Mrs. Sokim S.’s problem is that her field is far away from the irrigation system. So, to solve this problem, she is seeking a loan to dig a well. With the rest of the loan, she will buy pig feed.

Mrs. Sokim S. is the mother of two children, one of whom is studying in the local school, while the youngest one is five years old.

loans.use: To dig a well and buy pig feed

loans.name: Mrs. Thoy Kang Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has nine people who are villagers in Prey Sambuor village, Takeo province. Mrs. Thoy K. is the village bank president. She was born in 1959. She was selected by the other members, who will use portions of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Bav Ven, are farmers who rent a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell in order to support their family. Her husband is also a fisherman. However they try to work hard so that they can earn more income. So to improve her family's living condition, Mrs. Thoy K. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. She is the mother of six children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, and three of whom are attending in local school in addition to helping their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding to start a new busines

texts.en: This group in Tuol Sang Ka village, Takeo province consists of four members requesting a group loan. Mrs. Touch L. is the group leader and was born in 1967. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others attend local public school and help their parents’ businesses.

They support two children, one of whom is a furniture maker and the other of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory.

All the members will use a portion of their loan in varied ways to support their businesses in this current year. Mrs. Saroem N. is a chicken seller at her local market where she can earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Siem Eng, is a construction worker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. To improve her current business, Mrs. Saroem N. is applying for a loan to buy more chicken to resell. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are attending local school.

loans.use: To buy more chicken to resell

loans.name: Aikul's Group

texts.en:
Aikul A. is the leader of the group.  She is 50 and married. She has two sons; the first son graduated university and started to work, while the second is a student. 

In order to make money, Aikul’s husband works as a constructor in Bishkek and Aikul is engaged in cattle breeding. She started this activity 13 years ago with the initial investment of 7,000 soms and now, selling some cattle after fattening, she makes 1,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Aikul wants to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, she plans to increase the number of cattle she has and save money to contribute to her son’s wedding.

Kunsulu A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 46 and married. She has a son; he is 24 and works as a waiter in a restaurant. Kunsulu works as a cook at school and her husband is engaged in cattle breeding. Kunsulu and her husband started to breed cattle 15 years ago with the initial investment of 9,000 soms and now they make 2,700 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Kunsulu wants to purchase a calf for breeding. In the future, she wants to purchase a vehicle.

Ernis N., 50, is married.  He has two sons; both of them are working. In order to make money, Ernis provides welding services and his wife works as a cashier at school. Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 2,000 soms, Ernis started to breed cattle and resell it with a higher price. In this way, he makes 1,200 soms per month. He applied for the loan because he wants to purchase two calves for breeding. In the future, he wants to see his sons wed and to build a house for his first son.

Guljan T., 50, is married. She has two sons; the older son works as a waiter in a restaurant and the second is a student. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase two calves for breeding.

Gulnariya A., 44, is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. The older son provides car-repair services, the second is a farmer, and the daughter studies at school. Gulnariya works at school and in order to make money, she also breeds cattle. She has been doing it for 15 years. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase a calf for breeding. 

Nurjamal A., 52, is married. She has a son and a daughter. The son works in construction and the daughter studies at school. In order to make money, Nurjamal works as a cleaner at school and her husband is engaged in cattle breeding. He started to breed cattle six years ago with the initial investment of 9,000 soms and now he makes 1,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Nurjamal wants to purchase a calf to increase the number of cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has been practising mixed farming for 8 years in Kitale town, Western Kenya. He has employed one farm-hand. His main products are milk, vegetables and oranges which he sells at the local market. He also earns income from his timber business.

Ali recently completed his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70,000 KES and has requested this loan of 71,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with this loan he will be able to provide his family with enough milk for consumption. However, he faces the challenge of diseases and droughts which cause shortages of food and water.

Ali is 34 years old. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 12. All the children attend school. He is optimistic that in 5 years time, he will have a posho mill machine which will generate income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Batzol

texts.en:
Batzol E. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own ger- a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife takes care of their two children who are too young to go to the kindergarten. 

Batzol operates a carpentry business in his town. He started his carpentry business in 2008 and makes a variety of wooden items including ger accessories such as walls, doors, upper walls and poles to order for his customers but already had much experience in production. Today, his businesses is very popular among the locals. 

For the future, Batzol wants to own his own construction company. He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to  purchase some tool and kit for his wooden products business.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 51 years old. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 16 and 26. Three of the children are currently attending school.

Thomas has been operating his mixed farm in Kitale town, Western Kenya for 15 years and has employed one farm-hand. His farm produces maize, milk and beans which he sells to the local market. He solely depends on the income from his farming business to cater for the needs of his family.

Thomas recently completed his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70,000KES and has requested this loan of 71,200KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with this loan he will be able to buy a good dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The profits from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children.

In future, he plans to have 5 dairy cows and goats and be the main supplier of milk to the local market.

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en:
Davaanyam S. is 26 years old and lives in Uvs province, western Mongolia, together with his parents in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Davaanyam operates a wooden product making business, including ger accessories, in his town. The business is very family oriented, as his father designs their products while Davaanyam paints and decorates them, and his mother sews traditional Mongolian boots. He and his family also plant vegetables along with the wooden products business. Davaanyam started his wood products business in 2009 and expanded his business into making walls, upper walls, and poles for Mongolian gers. The business has been successful and they have grown a stable operation. Davaanyam attributes his success to the quality of his products, which is much desired by his customers. He is requesting a 350,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and paints for their wooden products business.

loans.name: Natividad
